website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Core i9-9900KS adds a booster rocket to one of the fastest gaming processors out there, but at a cost that most gamers don't need to pay to get the most out of their machines.
pros: Fastest processor to complement 1080p gaming on the market
Works on established base of Z390-chipset boards
cons: Modest overclocking ceiling in our sample
Liquid cooler recommended to squeeze out maximum performance

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 👍 I’m pretty happy with my new upgrade. Windows is running super fast by using the game boot mode. Got it over clocked to 5.20 gigahertz with out any heating problems. Temp is staying around 36 to 24 when idle. I’m very happy with it. I totally recommend this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Too hot too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: On Gigabyte Z390 Master this CPU can go up to 87 degree on 4.8GHz while stabilising video in Adobe Premiere, cooled by Corsair H115i Pro. On 5GHz it was ok for most of the time, even games were ok, but for video editing on 5GHz it was throttling. I switched from 8700K which is much better value. Next time Threadripper.
customer_reviews.author: morow

customer_reviews.title: overly complex and expensive packing but lightning quick (but hot) performance
customer_reviews.text: was quite surprised how elaborate and overly complicated the packing of this item is - a little much and consumers obviously end up paying for this. you need some very good cooling for this; i have a corsair 100i v2 and that keeps it around 94 degrees under load. the performance is phenomenal. installation of games, 500mb plus excel files and frame rate increases in games is obvious. will last a long time for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Fastest Desktop chip I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good all rounder. 50% Photoshop & 3DS Max. 30% VR & Games. and the rest, 10% programming &10% internet. I very nearly forked out for Threadripper but reasonably glad I didn't now. This is 'almost' as fast as my dual Xeon HP Z840 workstation i use at work (20-core/40 thread Xeon 2680 v2) in V-Ray (2500 vs 2200 OC on the 9900k) and much faster for games and 1/4 of the power consumption. Originally installed with a Hyper 212 turbo cooler that just didn't keep the heat under control, so was soon replaced with a 240mm water AIO (which is my only bugbear with these chips, they are HOT). Overall excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Penfold

customer_reviews.title: Top mainstream CPU today
customer_reviews.text: Simply most powerful mainstream CPU, I am running my games at 4k ultra settings, the highest CPU usage reached around 60% average 50% and some games just use like 10% , packaging is very cool
customer_reviews.author: Regimantas

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU
customer_reviews.text: Echoing other reviews the packaging was not great. The processor and its plastic case was fine, but there was nothing in the box to fill in all the loose space which meant the product was free to move around inside. The bubble wrap around the product was sufficient in keeping it from damage, despite this.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Super Speed
customer_reviews.text: First impressions was that the packaging was cool but a bit extreme an unnecessary. So far the performance is great. Windows running super quick and games as well. This will last a long time which is why i paid for this. You do need a good cooling system though.
customer_reviews.author: Gouldy59

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance
customer_reviews.text: Great performance from this, I'm currently running this with a ASUS ROG Maximus XI Hero with a MSI RTX 2080ti and have no trouble running some of the latest games at ultra on a 4K ultra wide monitor. Many tests suggest that his processor isn't that much better than the i7-9700k when you consider the difference in price. I couldn't really comment on that. Overall I'm happy to spend a bit extra to have an i9 in my rig. The packaging is a bit over the top and I was slightly baffled how to get into the case. I'd have just been happy with a standard box but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Philip & Amy

customer_reviews.title: expensive but good
customer_reviews.text: damn it is fast. when i swap back to my old macbook pro it takes an age to complete the same tasks. using with a Noctua NH-D15S as the other Noctua I tried first didn't fit in my case with the ram and gpu.. worth checking that sort of thing first. but the NHH-D15S keeps it pretty cool unless you're doing 3d rendering or something, then you better remember to keep your fans on full blast on the downside, the packaging is a travesty in this day and age. a huge hunch of crappy blue plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Steer

customer_reviews.title: Super fast processor!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the i7 4790k to the i9 9900k, due to the i7 causing a bottleneck in games. I looked at both 9th gen intel and 3rd gen ryzen. I chose the i9 mainly because it was cheaper to upgrade to from the z97 chipset because it was sale. The upgrade was a huge difference games like battlefield V and rainbow 6 siege run smoothers on my high refresh rate display, no longer shuttering.
customer_reviews.author: DolphinSpanker

customer_reviews.title: Drop in price - Good Processor
customer_reviews.text: I had been thinking of upgrading my PC for a while and when I saw this I decided to go for it, Did read all the ratings and I did record opening the package as one person had a bit of an issue but all was well - Great processor with the NZXT cooler I have now nice quiet fast gaming :-) I was telling a work college and looked on amazon and it had dropped £50 so was a bit miffed however this must be a by again offer - As went on to the Amazon site from my home and it was the same price!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: One got used, second was perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas as a gift as he really wanted it. Came on time, looked all good, package was a bit weird as it felt like it was open before. But anyways he build it in it didn't worked. After examinating the whole Core. problem was found and it looked burned, the whole Core was burned. We think it was used before and sent back and we just received used one. We returned it easily. Received replacement. Second one was on point, all good , packaging looked perfect. Build in, all working fully. Using now half a year everything seems fine. So have a look really close when received guys.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Beast Cpu...but I need help..
customer_reviews.text: Hi, this cpu is a beast... Before I used to get 50 to 60 fps on rtx 2060 in battlefield 5 in 1440p... After installing this cpu, i get) 80 to 110+ fps in the same card... The only problem i am having is the cpu temperature, its more than 90 to 98 °C when i am gaming... I am really worried about it...I reapplies thermal paste.. But no change.... What can I do? Do I need to upgrade cpu fan? Currently i am using hp omen default cpu fan...is it necessary to upgrage cpu fan... Are there any fan less then 20 pound? Because my budget is limited...kindly..suggest what can I do.
customer_reviews.author: Sumaiya Shipa

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant CPU
customer_reviews.text: First of all ill address some packaging reviews and say that mine was packaged perfectly, not even an inch of movement completely surrounded in bubblewrap. Installed on a gigabyte z390 gaming X mobo with new Corsair 3200mhz ram. Everything went smoothly with the install (be sure to apply enough thermal paste, the CPU isnt perfectly flat so some areas need more than others) CPU performance is great. The temps can be abit high during benchmarks (v high/extreme load) but while gaming it was at a safe temp. Loading times: it's done before you can blink. I'm one very happy customer, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: terry dawson

customer_reviews.title: Strong and stable lol
customer_reviews.text: I had a watercooled PC with Ryzen and it used to randomly crash and lose the overclock. I decided to go back to Intel as Amazon screwed up pricing and I managed to get it super cheap! Its been installed 4 months and never had a crash, it overclocks easily to 5GHz with no issues and hardly breaks a sweat. It comes in a cool looking box too ha ha
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.
customer_reviews.text: Best for gaming performance 2019, forgot Ryzen, just go see the benchmarks for yourself. This CPU comes out on top for gaming. I got a stable overclock to 5ghz on all cores on the ASUS maximus XI hero WiFi edition motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic CPU for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: The i9 9900k is a monster of a CPU for pretty much every task. I've paired mine up with a GTX 1080ti and 32 GB of DDR4 3000Mhz RAM and it's an absolute powerhouse. I upgraded from an i7 7700k and it has made a very noticable change on performance across the board (as you would expect.) Idling at a very cool 30-35 Celsius and peaking at 40-45 during gaming sessions. (My cooler is a Corsair H100i Platinum AIO Liquid cooler with 2 LL120 fans). I would highly recommend this processor for anyone looking at the 9th generation Intel chips as it and the rest of the i9 9900 variants are the only ones of that generation to feature hyperthreading.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU much faster than my I7 4790K I was going to go for a 9700K but I'm glad I didn't since I do a lot of video editing and needed that 8 extra HT. And my God is it fast I knocked 1 star off since there was rattling inside the cube the processor is fine though I may have got a golden sample since it seems very cool under load paired with a Z390 Aorus Master.
customer_reviews.author: xmrdevi1ishx

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance, doesn't get too hot
customer_reviews.text: I'd expected this to get pretty hot as I load it heavily for long periods, but my Noctua NH-U12A handles the heat easily. The idle power is also low, saving on the electric bill. The packaging is very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Leading Geek

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's not the best bang for your buck. But it is the most powerful Intel core processor
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Keep the packaging and use for a light display.
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok with no installation problems, In practice I don't know if the cost is realy justified over an I7 of the same speed although this I9 overclocks to 4.7Gb with no heating problems when used with a Corsair I100 cooler. Keep the plastic packaging and use as a fancy light display.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very powerful CPU
customer_reviews.text: getting hot quickly, Good cooling system is absolutely recommended. Running it at 4900MHz with a Corsair CW-9060033-WW H100i Hydro PRO RGB Liquid CPU Cooler at about 35°C - 40°C on idle. About the power, as an example, running Twitch stream along with game (Anno 1800) using CPU only at 1080p60 / 60FPS with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Marco F.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speed!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an i7 3ghz processor on a top of the range gigabyte x58 ud9 board that was quick, however this thing is insane, now using on a Gigabyte z390 ultra board with just 32 Gb of memory boots in 30 seconds max and I’m more than happy with the purchase, being half the cost of the total build this processor is well worth the extra money over an i7
customer_reviews.author: tony dudley

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid but not king anymore
customer_reviews.text: Was one of the best CPU you could by at the time. My PC is used mainly for work. I would say this CPU is a little overkill for gaming, run at about 20-30% on GTA5. Would I buy it again .... No.... AMD has taken the crown from team blue so worth looking at that now.
customer_reviews.author: Amandeep S.

customer_reviews.title: Fast but pricey
customer_reviews.text: A great chip but it does cost. The 8 cores/16 threads do make lite work of most things and allow for heavy usage when you need that extra power. Rendering 4k footage is pretty quick on this. Helps if the rest of your system is pretty decent to.
customer_reviews.author: EasyE

customer_reviews.title: Makes my 8 core AMD look like treacle
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that for rendering movies this just flies. Much computer speed depends on a lot of the other components so it is difficult to see the difference but rendering is almost all down to the processor and boy does this thing fly!
customer_reviews.author: TAC45

customer_reviews.title: Intel Core i9-9900K Retail
customer_reviews.text: Not a cheap CPU, needs lot so of cooling, have six fans plus a fan for memory as well. had problems fitting the cpu fan, not the cpu. Otherwise super fast, compared to my i7 3770K. No problems so far, running as a sever, i.e. since Feb, continuously June now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: good luck overclocking
customer_reviews.text: never expected this, thought it was AMD that got hot, you can 100% load this with high end cooler and will reach 100c on stock! without overclock, do your home work, im on process of returning mine for another but certain its the CPU manufacturing errors! may be go core i7
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: A superb processor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the amd 3900x being impossible to get hold of, and I'm glad I did. It runs at low temperatures and eats up any task you throw at it. Packaging is cool and interesting, but a little excessive.
customer_reviews.author: El Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming cpu 100%
customer_reviews.text: This is the fastest CPU i have owned i know people say ryzen is the best CPU price to performance but i have had 3 ryzen cpus with 3200mhz ram and they all had stuttering problems in games soon i got 9900k all my stutters had gone so if you want a silky smooth gaming experience the 9900k is a great choice
customer_reviews.author: Shaun maddison

customer_reviews.title: Speed Demon.
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot for reviews about this CPU running really hot. Which is does, but with the correct cooling it's perfect. No performance hiccups or issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: BGLZE

customer_reviews.title: big wasteful packaging in the event of a climate crisis!
customer_reviews.text: small slim boxing inside a big large plastic dome (dome is just wasteful and not needed) as for processor, does the job, upgraded from the intel core i5 9600k
customer_reviews.author: michael french

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU.
customer_reviews.text: This processor is great. The packaging was good but probably too much for a small item. Easy to install. Intel turbo boost is set to 48x multipler so you don't need to keep the clock at 5ghz. If overclocking, the CPU gets hot so you need a decent cooler.
customer_reviews.author: K. Worton

customer_reviews.title: I9 chip great
customer_reviews.text: In a plastic case which was nerve racking to open with such fragiel chip inside
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Great all rounder
customer_reviews.text: Great a little on the expensive side but wow it handles everything I can throw at it with ease I will be using this cpu for many years to come
customer_reviews.author: ILikeBargains

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power. But 4 stars because the delivery company decided to put the box in a bag and use it as football which smashed the blue plastic orb to bits. But the processor is fine at least.
customer_reviews.author: Echo Mirage

customer_reviews.title: 5.0ghz
customer_reviews.text: Every core clocked at 5ghz. Intel is king in my eyes. Amd you aint bad though. King of gaming still has his throne
customer_reviews.author: Mumin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: First thing which you notice is the box - looks cool. The processor is very powerful. So far works very well
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good chip
customer_reviews.text: It's a good solid chip, have excellent stability and speed since I installed it. I am not sure it's the best in terms of performance/price, but otherwise very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Student

customer_reviews.title: Fast with a nice box?
customer_reviews.text: Fast, very fast. Nice box too, kind of like a trophy. Managed to OC to a stable mix of 4.6GHz to 5.0 GHz with a Corsair h115i Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Scott

customer_reviews.title: An absolute beast of a CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive but is currently one of the best high end CPU's on market, be aware if you buy this, be expecting to cool it with at minimum a 360 radiator triple fan setup, this could runs very hot.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Absolute power house!
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is a beast. Bought it for my new PC build and clocked it at standard recommended settings - deals with everything perfectly! More than enough room for overclocking too!
customer_reviews.author: Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and presented beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Amazing presentation (comes in a little box which feels like a tribute to the crystal maze). Makes you feel like you've bought something really special. Install - Just had to place it in the cpu slot. No issues- Powerful piece of kit. cons: Pricey
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: brillaint
customer_reviews.text: Cpu is powerful does everything you need. not temp problems what so ever, overclocked to 5.2. I upgraded from i5 9700k which was always running at max on gaming and streaming, so brought this, and plenty of room left in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Probets

customer_reviews.title: best all around
customer_reviews.text: best cpu sofar, also unlike rayzen, u do not need to buy dedicated graphic card because onboard car is support 4k out put
customer_reviews.author: Bahmen

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Had 9900k and 9600k for tests and if comes about gaming only go for i5, however i5 was not able to do streaming in the same time at decent resolution. All depends on you needs
customer_reviews.author: wlodipawel87

customer_reviews.title: Its a hot cpu, needs good cooling.
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu. Destroys everything thrown at it. Needs good cooling solution to sustain the high clocks.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantinos Plaskasovitis

customer_reviews.title: best cpu on the market
customer_reviews.text: this thing is quick as hell its the best cpu on the market for gaming plus i got it on sale so never paid over the odds for
customer_reviews.author: James p.

customer_reviews.title: dont look at reviews
customer_reviews.text: IF you buying this and looking at reviews, DONT, go find much better info on google. Know what you are buying from proffesionals with full specs. Ryzen is better value across the board
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE be careful when purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned by other reviews please be careful when purchasing this item, what I received WASN’T the i9900K processor. Someone had obviously switched them out and returned it. Please be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dylan Wa Halley

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good performance
customer_reviews.text: £300 cheaper than 10th gen, and just as good performance, recommend this for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Valka

customer_reviews.title: Speedy
customer_reviews.text: Required that I updated the BIOS on my MOBO for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Stubbsy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very good processor it does everything that I needed it to do
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Performance
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cpu, very fast, overclocked to 5 ghz and it performs smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Haris

customer_reviews.title: Power Horse
customer_reviews.text: Amazing CPU, super powerful and paired with a good cooler has a reasonable amount of overclock in it aswell. Only downside was that the lovely box it comes in was damaged on arrival, could probably do with a little more protection than a black pouch and an amazon box.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Beverley

customer_reviews.title: Sons happy
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it was over the moon with the outside packaging he’s kept it and has it in his room on display, it is what it is fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Amazing worth the buy but come on saves the world reduce the amount of plastic round it
customer_reviews.text: As much as I love this amazing product fast can not complain the box is a bit over the top to be honest novelty worn off the second cut the tap and it would not clip back together making me just through the while case just in the bin
customer_reviews.author: Josh gamer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it for programming and gaming it is working perfectly for both. With suitable cooler (any proper 360mm) the temperature never goes up to 60 degrees Celsius. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Nagy Csaba

customer_reviews.title: Best there is right now.
customer_reviews.text: It is expensive but you know what you are going buying if your reading this....
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Gummer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it...
customer_reviews.text: What a monster.. will last for the next 5 years
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cpu
customer_reviews.text: Great out of the box performance but I now have it running 5.2ghz across all the cores and temperatures hit 80 degrees Celsius maximum under full load and stress testing.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great performance but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Great power but pricey as hell. Straight to 5ghz without issue but you're probably better off with a ryzen as you'll pay a third to half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Gaming/editing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for gaming and other things you could use I recommend getting this cpu only if you save enough for the rest of the parts for your gaming pc or what every you use, you don’t have to upgrade it until few years time!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan and Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Workstation PC project
customer_reviews.text: With s bit of fine tuning, 4.8 GHz all cores on air (Dark Rock Pro 4) with temps around 75-77 C.
customer_reviews.author: Sergiu

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu
customer_reviews.text: Love the box it came in. great fast chip for gaming Make sure you have a good cooler for it though
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Its really easy to install, and you get the performance for the price that you pay.
customer_reviews.author: Ronkis

customer_reviews.title: Dead CPU
customer_reviews.text: Arrived but was a dead cpu so having to send it back will change this depending on the replacement turn around as I know it's not the distributors fault
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Rip off!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So this was meant to be new.. box came absolutely destroyed and squashed this was me opening it up and missing the cpu itself completely ripped off!!!!
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: I9 the beast
customer_reviews.text: What i can say its i9 cant go wrong with that
customer_reviews.author: Darius Stasiulis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to upgrade my son’s gaming pc. Very fast delivery and easy to fit.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMIE H.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Got my box on display and my cores running high
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming! Very happy from upgrading from a i7 6700k to a i9 9900K.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Collett

customer_reviews.title: highly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: the best price i have found . amazing packaging and fast delivery . :)
customer_reviews.author: Gulia Amiri

customer_reviews.title: It’s the best.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say - a beast, a very productive beast.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Carlsson

customer_reviews.title: Best you can get for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast if a CPU if your a passionate gamer and or a streamer like myself you will not regret buying one.
customer_reviews.author: smokedog77

customer_reviews.title: Arrived With broken packaging
customer_reviews.text: The item is great works really well with games but the hexagon was broken inside the bit that holds the processor. one part had snapped off in transit
customer_reviews.author: scott domeracki

customer_reviews.title: Best performance for games
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, just a side note the Asus Maximus XI series motherboards come with 4 phase VRM and can barely clock this at 5ghz stable. Do not pair this processor with an Asus motherboard - this is coming from someone who almost exclusively buys Asus motherboards for PC builds since 2007
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 7 days
customer_reviews.text: Took almost a month after pre-order to get it. 7 days after install it died. Probably won't able to get a replacement until sometime in 2019. Horrible job intel. I'll go with AMD next time!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D Farris

customer_reviews.title: Works on Z370!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my i7-8700k with this i9-9900k on my Asus Maximus X Hero Z370 motherboard. It works! I was skeptical after seeing reviews about how much power this CPU consumed, but it works without issues on a premium Z370 board. I'm also only using a 240mm All-In-One cooler and think it will just barely be enough with a 5.0GHz all-core overclock, although it may get interesting on long sessions on a hot summer days! Overclocked to; 4.8Ghz @ 1.20v 5.0GHz @ 1.25v 5.1GHz @ 1.28v 5.2GHz @ 1.35v 5.3GHz @ 1.40v AVX workloads above 4.7GHz, caused immediate overheating and BSOD!
customer_reviews.author: William Docter

customer_reviews.title: Wait for new RYZEN
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly backwards compatible with z370 but this benchmarked lower than my 8700k. Temperatures also jumped worse with an AIO despite it having a soldered TIM.
customer_reviews.author: Gurjit Gill

customer_reviews.title: He Likes It
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son for his gaming computer. He pretty much spends his every waking moment shouting into a headset about things I only learned when in the military. I can't tell you how nice it is to have the TV and my wife all to myself.
customer_reviews.author: TrippSter

customer_reviews.title: Should have kept my 8700k
customer_reviews.text: I was cruising at 5.3 ghz on 6 cores at 1.3 v. Now I have a space heater in my room, yeah 8 cores but 5.1 ghz and 1.4 v. I should have went Zen :(
customer_reviews.author: svan

customer_reviews.title: It is the best CPU for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Intel didn't lie this is the best CPU on the market for gaming. It's also good at a lot of other applications. But what do you expect from an 8 core 16 thread beast like this. Everyone knows this, you just have a bunch of people complaining because of the price and trying to tank the review score because they can't afford this chip. By their logic they should also be giving Ferrari a bad time because their cars value per dollar is horrible, and the cars are over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work on any motherboard I bought
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it was DOA or what, but I tried using this i9 on two different ASUS motherboards advertised to take 9th Gen chips and neither worked. It's frustrating buying products that don't work as advertised. Again, I don't know if the motherboards were the problem, but after two failed attempts, it was looking like this chip might have had something wrong with it. I didn't want to keep throwing good money after bad, so I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Kleen

customer_reviews.title: The i9-9900K is a monster in absolutely every way!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an Intel i7-3770k 3.5ghz Quad-core from 2012. This i9-9900k blows it completely out of the water. I upgraded because with the 3770k it took me 7 1/2 hours to convert one hour of 4K video. The i9 on the other hand does one hour of 4K video in about 90 minutes. Granted, I do have 32 GB of 3600 Mhz ram paired to it via a z390 mother board, but if you convert video for a living or for fun this processor is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: imgreenlantern2

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I came from a 8700k and let me say this is a beast of a cpu! Many ppl talk bad about it that it’s hot and not stable that’s all BS this is a really fast and stays cool cpu I had it oc to 5.2 and didn’t event get passed 70c and at 5.0 it stays cool and very stable for long gaming I deff would buy this if your a streamer and gamer and only have one pc or you want to have the best!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box CPU IHS had distinctive marks of use on it's surface.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on 11.12.2019. Received it a couple of days ago after shipping it to another country. At first examination of the CPU while it was still in package, I immediately noticed distinctive signs of use on heat spreader.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: AMD to i9, well worth it! Love my i9
customer_reviews.text: I went from a Ryzen 2700x to this i9 9900k processor. It is the best decision I made! I was dropping frames while gaming, and every once in a while the PC would shut off with the AMD processor. With my new intel set up, it’s silky smooth! FPS have minimal hiccups, you will drop a frame or two ranging from 240 to 190/220 and back up to 240...I have everything paired up nicely to where my graphics card Rtx2070 is not bottle necked with the CPUs incapabilities. I absolutely love my i9!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Clodaman

customer_reviews.title: Fast, and doesn't run that hot.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the 9900k with the Noctua NH-D15 and even with all cores running at 5 GHz the idle temps are between are relatively cool at 32-37 degrees C. At load my CPU typically runs between 50-65 degrees C. It is easy to install and overclock (if you don't know what to do then just read your manual or watch JayzTwoCents so that you can learn how to properly install your CPU). The CPU Core Voltage that I'm running at fluctuates between 1.341 - 1. 367 volts on average (for those wondering).
customer_reviews.author: Mr Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Already opened
customer_reviews.text: So, my processor came and the stickers weren't really attached anymore and there's signs of the cpu being used before from markings on the cpu casing as well. Now that the return window is closed bc I've only now had time to mess with it, I guess it's all on me now.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, driver who delivered it is an idiot
customer_reviews.text: CPU itself is amazing so far. Have had zero issues since I've had it. Definitely worth the money if you can afford it. Now onto why I give it a 4 of 5 since the product is so great. The driver who delivered it signed the delivery themselves and left it at my backdoor which is not fenced in and is less than 10 feet from my shifty neighbor's door and next to a busy street with a sidewalk. It's a very expensive product that required a signature and they didn't even bother to leave it in a secure location?
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Moody

customer_reviews.title: Just get the right cooling
customer_reviews.text: It works great! Coupled with a corsair h100 cooler it doesn't get above 69°C when gaming or rendering MP4s. I've read a review saying this one is much hotter than his i7-5820k. I've had the exact reverse experience, and then I got suspicious of my 5820k running so much hotter (with a corsair H80) than my i9. Turns out the H80 pump was set to operate on low. I turned that up to 11 and now all my cpus are nice and cool. So really it's about your cooler and how you configure it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic CPU  "Cooling Fan not Included"
customer_reviews.text: There are only two problems with this i9 CPU. The first is figuring out how to open the plastic container that holds the CPU. Being cute doesn't necessarily make good sense. The second is that there is no cooling fan that comes with the CPU. It is sort of like "Batteries not included". I am sure that this not only saves money for Intel, but most installers don't use the provided fan as they prefer a bigger cooling fan with more capacity. Overall the i9 is a great chip.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer teacher

customer_reviews.title: not for all
customer_reviews.text: The i9-9900k is not for everyone.. Only enthusiasts will pay for any bit more of performance. I upgraded from a 6700k and I love it, mine was able to overclock out of the box to 5.0 ghz on all cores, although the temperatures will need to be watched, 38C idle and 72C during aida 64, using a 120mm AIO at full speed with a Noctua 120mm slim fan.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Probably a good cpu. Wouldn't know
customer_reviews.text: Mine was a fake, talked to Intel support, was treated like I was dumb and got nowhere usefully. Shoulda went ryzen Amazon took care of me with a lable to return it and a refund
customer_reviews.author: Justus Cucuro

customer_reviews.title: The Intel Core i9-9900k is a BEAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded from a Core i7-9700k due to issues while gaming/streaming. This thing is an absolute BEAST of a CPU! Previously while playing Call of Duty: Modern Warfare (2019), my CPU utilization would be pegged out at 100% on the i7-9700k. This was causing system stability issues while running Nvidia RTX Voice and Streamlabs OBS Studio. After the upgrade, I am not seeing CPU utilization go above 70%, and the stability issues are gone!
customer_reviews.author: hfaze

customer_reviews.title: Amazing processor
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any problems with the CPU since finishing my build. I am using EKWB custom water cooling parts and a custom loop. Parts list below: CPU: I9-9900K Motherboard: Asus Maximus Formula XI Z390 GPU: RTX 2080 Ti Founder Edition RAM: 32GB Corsair Vengeance Pro RGB (4 x 8) Storage: Samsung 970 Evo 1TB m.2 PSU: Corsair RM1000x Case: Spectre Singularity Cooling: EKWB CPU and GPU waterblocks I am able to overclock my 9900k to 5.0 Ghz with no problems, haven't tried to go any further but when I am idling I sit at around 27 celcius. Haven't had the chance to game yet but I will update temps and max overclock when I have the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming cpu
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cpu purchase i have ever made, its smooth and fast, overclocked to 5ghz all core with a h150i AIO.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I9-9900k Thermals are good
customer_reviews.text: A lot of reviews were saying this run hot but I'm cooling mine with Corsair h100i aio cooler push pull configuration with 4 noctua 120mm fans and stock temps don't go above 30 degrees celcius in any game then when it's turbo it's around 55 at Max...performance is mind blowing but then again I had upgraded from AMD fx-8350 and my frames have increased by 100+ fps in most games...paired with gigabyte Aurora ultra and Corsair vengeance 3000mhz ddr4 ram evga 1070ti and the performance crushes anything I can throw at it...buy this processor the i9-9900k is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice processor
customer_reviews.text: I've had quite a few processors over the years including the good ol' i7-4790K, Ryzen 2700X, and more recently the 3900X (which had tons of problems with posting) so I gave up on the 3900X after swapping multiple components including PSU, GPU, Memory and Motherboards. Went back to the 9900K and it's been smooth sailing since. Using with an Asus motherboard with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Trailblazer15
